trace.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to find someone or something that has disappeared by searching for them carefully
trace.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: She had given up all hope of tracing her missing daughter.
Police are trying to trace a young woman who was seen near the accident.
trace.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to find the origins of when something began or where it came from
trace.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: They’ve traced their ancestry to Scotland.
The style of these paintings can be traced back to early medieval influences.
trace.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to study or describe the history, development, or progress of something
trace.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Sondheim’s book traces the changing nature of the relationship between men and women.
trace.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to copy a drawing, map etc by putting a piece of transparent paper over it and then drawing the lines you can see through the paper
trace.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to draw real or imaginary lines on the surface of something, usually with your finger or toe
trace.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: Rosie’s fingers traced a delicate pattern in the sand.
trace.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a small sign that shows that someone or something was present or existed
trace.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: There was no trace of anyone having entered the room since then.
Petra’s lost all trace of her German accent.
Officers were unable to find any trace of drugs.
The plane vanished without a trace.
trace.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a very small amount of a quality, emotion, substance etc that is difficult to see or notice
trace.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: I saw the faintest trace of a smile cross Sandra’s face.
trace.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a search to find out where a telephone call came from, using special electronic equipment
trace.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: The police put a trace on the call.
trace.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: the mark or pattern made on a screen or on paper by a machine that is recording an electrical signal
trace.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: one of the two pieces of leather, rope etc by which a cart or carriage is fastened to an animal pulling it
